intro: Rondeletia merilloana, commonly known as the golden rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a smooth texture and dark green color.
